page.title: 04Religion - Winchfield Area.
page.content: {St. Mary's Church,Winchfield}is believed to date from 1150. The Chancel Arch is Norman. The Church contains memorials to the Rudyerd,Beauclerk & Charrington families who have owned the Manor at various times. Morning services are held fortnightly & afternoon services/ Sunday-school are held every Sunday. Near the M3 is the site of{Wintney {Priory}(founded c.1190 for Cistercian Nuns). Only a section of wall remains. {St.Mary's Church, Hartley Wintney,}was in regular use from 1234 until 1870 when St.John's Church was built in nearby Hartley Wintney. St.Mary's is now maintained as a redundant Church by public donations. It is sometimes used for weddings & the cemetery is next to it.The recently discovered {Medieval wall paintings}are the main treasure in this rural Church.
